description.narrative: The project consists of three main components: improving the coordination mechanisms for national development projects, formulation of the mid-term innovation development strategy,preparation for introduction of digital banking in TFEB

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: 1.1 Manual on financing of projects by external lending sources developed and approved 1.2 Number of recommendations accepted for improvement of coordination system of international financing 1.3 Conference on financing of development in Turkmenistan 1.4 Number of employees of Bank and ministries/agencies, who received a certificate on project management 1.5 Number of employees of Bank and ministries/agencies, trained in attracting external loans and conducting negotiations 1.6 Number of employees of Bank and ministries/agencies training in project preparation, project appraisal, financial analysis, monitoring and evaluation. 2.1 Mid-term bank development strategy developed and approved 3.1 Targeted strategy on introduction of digital banking in TFEB developed

comment.narrative:
1.1 As a regulatory mechanism of project coordination, a Manual was developed setting out the main requirements and criteria, which prospective borrowers must meet in applying for financing for development projects. The manual is intended to set standardized format, content and quality on the requests submitted by state agencies, thereby facilitating bank’s task in reviewing, vetting and prioritizing the requests.
1.2 In the purpose of strengthening cooperation with international financial organizations, and the development of an active dialogue on international financing, as well as stimulate the inflow of investments into the country and increase its international prestige, International consultants have made a detailed review of the existing system of cooperation with International Financial Institutions and give recommendations for its improvement and optimization.
1.3 International Conference on “Partnership for Development Financing at the Heart of the Great Silk Road” was organized jointly by the United Nations Development Programme and the State Bank for Foreign Economic Affairs of Turkmenistan on 20-21 June 2018 in Ashgabat, Turkmenistan. The Conference provided the unique space to advance the financing for development agenda in Turkmenistan by bringing together high-level officials from the Government of Turkmenistan, the UN system, the international financial institutions (IFIs), and business sector executives to explore new opportunities for development financing in Turkmenistan.
1.4 Within the framework of cooperation between UNDP and PricewaterhouseCoopers, the training was conducted by the PricewaterhouseCoopers Academy for 20 bank employees on the Project Management. Project management helps to more effectively develop, plan and implement projects for achievement the goals. This training was very important for improving the corporate governance structure. The participants of the training studied all aspects of the implementation of the project, from initiation to its completion.
1.5 An intensive workshop on the Strategic Negotiation Skills was conducted by SkillFocus Consultancy to strengthen soft skills of 24 employees of the bank. This workshop was designed as a skill-enhancement workshop for the management staff of the bank by interactive method of learning, which allowed participants to explore the best approaches or solutions to their own specific negotiation challenges. Through this methodology, the participants were encouraged to examine how they need to enhance the quality of their personal input into any negotiation process.
1.6 An intensive workshop was conducted by Stratigos to explore the potential for the development of an impact investment ecosystem in Turkmenistan for 30 employees of the financial and economic sector of Turkmenistan. The workshop helps to strengthen the capacity of private sector entities, bankers and Ministry of Finance officials to understand the benefits and limitations of the spectrum of innovative financing instruments. 2.1 The Bank Innovative Business Development Strategy was developed by PricewaterhouseCoopers to achieve key priority objectives in the mid-term perspective and strengthening bank’s capacity in the key business areas, such as retail banking, SME banking, corporate business and project financing. The strategy focuses on strengthening corporate governance, promoting innovative and competitive financial services, strengthening banking infrastructure, improving financial literacy and consumer protection for bank’s clients - households and enterprises. 3.1 The Bank IT strategy was formulated by PricewaterhouseCoopers and targeted for the development of digital banking, which will focus on cyber security improvement and creation of new digital products and services provided by the bank, digital sales channels, increasing the quantity and quality of digital financial services for the population; implementation of global experience in the area of digital banking; ensuring transparency in performing banking operations.
1. Operational and financial closure of the project; 2. Development of new Project Document as second phase of the current project;
1.The project was operationally and financially closured; 2. The new Project Document for the second phase of the current project was developed;
